meanings.sent1: The ensheathing vines wrapped around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The ensheathing fog blanketed the valley in the early morning.
meanings.sent3: The ensheathing scarf kept her warm on the chilly day.
meanings.sent4: The ensheathing darkness of the night made everything mysterious.
meanings.sent5: The ensheathing arms of the octopus protected its soft body from predators.

meanings.definition: Covering or protecting something with a sheath
meanings.sent1: He was ensheathing the sword in its leather scabbard.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar was ensheathing itself in a silky cocoon.
meanings.sent3: She was ensheathing the fragile glass ornament in bubble wrap.
meanings.sent4: The knight was ensheathing his arm in a metal gauntlet.
meanings.sent5: The chef was ensheathing the knife in a plastic cover for safety.
